intro: Zatarendia egyptiaca, commonly known as the Egyptian zatarendia, is a flowering plant native to Egypt. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. Zatarendia egyptiaca is often found growing in rocky soils along the edges of deserts and dry riverbeds.
